metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19132 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Squid before 4.4, when SNMP is enabled, allows a denial of service (Memory Leak) via an SNMP packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.2
squid-cgi - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.2
squid-common - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.2
squid-purge - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.2
squid3 - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.2
squidclient - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> snmp port is disabled by default in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: squid3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27-1ubuntu1.2').
